title: Schedule-Layout & data hookup (DIBEST-376)
custom_preconds: As a YES Network viewer, I want to check out their TV schedule on their website.
custom_steps: 1. Navigate to URL http://yes-next-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/info/schedule
custom_expected:
-New schedule designs are implemented

https://zpl.io/9qJQnmy

-Values in the spreadsheet appear in the schedule table

-Date picker/calendar only allows users to select up to the last date schedule data is available

-The schedule document will be added via Forge. Any new uploaded document replaces existing content on the site

-Schedule page will continue to live at same URL as on current site

title: Set Minimum body content height and pin footer
custom_preconds: As a PO, I want the footer to always appear pinned to the bottom of the page on the YES Network site, even when there isn't enough content to fill the entire page.
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to URL: http://yes-next-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com
2. Verify footer always appears pinned to the bottom of the page by opening different sections.
custom_expected:
-Minimum body height is set

-Footer is pinned to the bottom of the page

-Verified on BETA by QA and product

title: VSM-Apply text color to tables
custom_preconds: As a user I want to be able to read the table text font
custom_steps: 1. Access URL: http://yes-next-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/info/national-availability
custom_expected:
-Table fonts display in the same color as other body text on site: #242424
-Example of this working as expected on MLB.com:

https://www.mlb.com/mlbpaa/events

title: VSM-SEO properties do not display on front end
VSM-Heading is missing background color
custom_preconds:
Editors are applying the heading styling to hero images in VSM, but it is not rendering on the front-end

User must access: http://yes-next-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/info/centerstage-tickets
custom_steps:
1. Open link: http://yes-next-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/info/centerstage-tickets
2. Verify Heading "CenterStage Tickets" field appears on the front and has background color
custom_expected: - Heading field appears on the front end

title: VSM-Respect isPopup in homepage modules
custom_preconds: As an editor, I want some links in the mixed feed and other homepage modules to open in new tabs. I want to set this in VSM.
custom_steps: 1. Navigate to URL: http://yes-next-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/homepage
custom_expected:
-If isPopup is set to true, links open in new tab

-Implemented and verified BETA by stakeholder

title: Double vertical scroll appears at all sizes on desktop
custom_preconds:
Two vertical scrollbars appear throughout the BETA YES website when viewing the site on desktop devices

user must access URL: http://yes-next-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/liberty/news/jonquel-jones-introductory-press-conference-scheduled-for-friday-jan-20
custom_steps:
1. Open URL: http://yes-next-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/liberty/news/jonquel-jones-introductory-press-conference-scheduled-for-friday-jan-20
2. VerifY that only one vertical scrollbar appears on the right hand side of the BETA YES website when viewing the site on desktop devices.
custom_expected: - Only one vertical scrollbar should appear on the right hand side of the BETA YES website when viewing the site on desktop devices.

title: Homepage-All links on BETA homepage are opening in MLB BETA context
custom_preconds: User must access URL: http://yes-next-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/homepage
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to URL: http://yes-next-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/homepage
2. Hover over & click/tap on a link
3. Observe it opening in MLB BETA context
custom_expected:
All links open in the proper context

- If a YES Network story, video, link is created in Forge it should open in the YES Network context

- If a link is expected to open in another context (ex TikTok), link opens in that context

title: VSM-Set limit for Blurb Display
custom_preconds: As a homepage editor, I want to set a limit on how much content appears in the mixed feeds.
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to URL: http://yes-next-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/homepage
2. On the display at the top of the homepage, make sure the blurb text (below the headline and before the link) does not exceed 160 characters
3. If the blurb is too long, the expected behavior is that the text is cut off and a 'â€¦' appears at the end.
custom_expected: Limit is set so only the first 160 characters, including spaces of the summary appears in the mixed feed as the Blurb Display (string)

title: Schedule-Layout & data hookup
custom_preconds:
As a YES Network viewer, I want to check out their TV schedule on their website.

Schedule page will continue to live at same URL as on current site)

title: Next News-Ad Requirements
custom_preconds:
As a YES partner, I want to be able to sell ad slots on the YES News Archive.
As an advertiser, I want my ads to appear on the YES News Archive.
custom_steps: 1. Access URL: http://yes-next-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/news
custom_expected:
AC

Banner ad appears after every 6th article

Banner sizes should be 728x90 and 320x50

Reviewed/approved by AdOps on BETA & PROD

title: Update story body font
custom_preconds: As an editor at YES, I want the body of the article to have a different font than the headlines.
custom_steps: 1. Navigate to URL: http://yes-next-prod.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/news/brooklyn-nets-acquire-royce-o-neale

title: Create news indexes + data hook
custom_preconds: As an editor, I want content to appear on the News archives. I want that data to come from Forge. I want each club to have their own archive. I want a general YES Network archive to exist.
custom_steps: 1. Navigate to URL: http://yes-next-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/news
custom_expected:
-News index page for each team + YES Network is created in Next app

-Layout matches Zeplin (below)

-Team Forge data is connected to pages

-On load, the 15 most recent articles appear (dapi $limit=15)

-Articles appear sorted newest to oldest (dapi $sort)

-Article content appears

-Clicking/tapping an article opens that article in a new tab

-Titles, dates appear correctly

DESIGNS
https://zpl.io/aNJyRn9

DATA

-News editorial selections (for news landing pages)

Data file

YES Network

https://beta-dapi.cms.opprops.mlbinfra.com/v2/content/en-us/sel-news-yes-network

Yankees

https://beta-dapi.cms.opprops.mlbinfra.com/v2/content/en-us/sel-news-yankees

Nets

https://beta-dapi.cms.opprops.mlbinfra.com/v2/content/en-us/sel-news-nets

NYCFC

https://beta-dapi.cms.opprops.mlbinfra.com/v2/content/en-us/sel-news-nycfc

Liberty

https://beta-dapi.cms.opprops.mlbinfra.com/v2/content/en-us/sel-news-liberty

NFL

https://beta-dapi.cms.opprops.mlbinfra.com/v2/content/en-us/sel-news-nfl

title: Add Date Picker to page and functionality
custom_preconds:
As a fan, I want to be able to select stories from a given day on the calendar.

User must access URL http://yes-next-prod.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/news/2022/06
custom_steps:
AC

1. Date picker appears on page

2. All content appears in newest-oldest order

3. Selecting only a month displays content for that month and the current year

4. Selecting only a year displays content for that year and the first month of that year 

5. Selecting a month and a year displays content for that month and year

6. Reset button is disabled until a selection has been made

7. Clicking/tapping Reset clears the selection and displays the 15 most recent articles
custom_expected:
- Date picker appears on page

- All content appears in newest-oldest order

- Selecting only a month displays content for that month and the current year

- Selecting only a year displays content for that year and the first month of that year 

- Selecting a month and a year displays content for that month and year

- Reset button is disabled until a selection has been made

- Clicking/tapping Reset clears the selection and displays the 15 most recent articles

title: Next News - Back to Top Button
custom_preconds:
As a fan, I want to quickly get back to the top of the YES News index page I am viewing.

User must access URL http://yes-next-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/news
custom_steps:
1. Back to top button appears on page

2. Button initially appears once the 7th article comes into view

3. Once in view, the button is pinned to the bottom of the page: 50px from the bottom of the viewable area & 50px from the edge of the viewable area

4. Clicking/tapping the button brings the user back to the top of the page
custom_expected:
- Back to top button appears on page

- Button initially appears once the 7th article comes into view

- Once in view, the button is pinned to the bottom of the page: 50px from the bottom of the viewable area & 50px from the edge of the viewable area

- Clicking/tapping the button brings the user back to the top of the page

title: Next News - Deeplinks
custom_preconds:
As a fan, I want to be able to send my friends a direct link to a set of articles that I have found in the YES Network news archive.

User must access URL http://yes-next-prod.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/news/2022/06
custom_steps:
1. User should access URL http://yes-next-prod.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/news/2022/06

2. URL updates when a date is selected to: yesnetwork.com/$team$/news/YYYY/MM

3. Verified on QA, BETA by QA and Product
custom_expected:
- URL updates when a date is selected to: yesnetwork.com/$team$/news/YYYY/MM

- Verified on QA, BETA by QA and Product

title: Next News - Add messaging if no Results in index
custom_preconds:
As a fan, I want to be alerted in some way that there isn't any content for the Month/Year combo I have selected on the News Archive.

User must access URL http://yes-next-prod.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/liberty/news/2017/01
custom_steps:
AC

1. If no results available for a particular month + year, display messaging that reads: There is no News to display for the time period selected.
custom_expected: - If no results available for a particular month + year, display messaging that reads: There is no News to display for the time period selected.

Page has a 2-column layout

28. Headline

29. Hero image

30. Author, date; Social share links

31. Line break

32. Body of article

33. Share icons & links

34. Line break

35. Tagline

36. Line break

37. 300x250 ad

38. More stories module with three (3) stories vertically arranged

39. YES email signup module

Refer to Zeplin for styling, spacing, etc.

- XLarge-Large 1024+

- Page has a 2-column layout

- In the main column

- hero image

- Author, date; Social share links

- Line break

- Body of article

- Share icons & links

- Line break

- Tagline

- 300x250 ad slot

- Page has a single-column layout

- Headline

- Hero image

- Author, date; Social share links

- Line break

- Body of article

- Share icons & links

- Line break

- Tagline

- Line break

- 300x250 ad

- More stories module with three (3) stories horizontally arranged

- 300x250 ad slot

*XSmall 567 and smaller

Page has a single-column layout

- Headline

- Hero image

- Author, date; Social share links

- Line break

- Body of article

- Share icons & links

- Line break

title: Next News - Webviews for YES App
custom_preconds:
As a marketer with YES Network, I need webviews of our News to be used in the YES App.

User must access URL: http://yes-next-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/app-yes/yankees/news/greg-weissert-named-triple-a-pitcher-of-the-year
custom_steps:
AC

1. Webview route is created in next app

-/app-yes

2. These elements do not appear in stories in the webview route:

-Header

-Footer

-Social icons

-More Stories module

-Ads continue to display

3. New webview-centric MRSS/RSS feed is created

4. Stories contained in the feed open in the new webview route
custom_expected:
- Webview route is created in next app

/app-yes

- These elements do not appear in stories in the webview route:

Header

Footer

Social icons

More Stories module

Ads continue to display

- New webview-centric MRSS/RSS feed is created

- Stories contained in the feed open in the new webview route

title: Next News - More $Stories $Module
custom_preconds:
As a fan, I want to be able to quickly access the News archive for my favorite team covered on YES Network.
As a PO, I want to add a link to the More Stories module in Articles that will take users to that team's news archive.

User must access link: http://yes-next-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/news/anton-tinnerholm-departs-new-york-city-football-club
custom_steps:
AC

1. When the More $Team$ News link is clicked/tapped, takes the user to the news archive of the team associated to that article. For example: This article's More Nets News link: YES' Sarah Kustok named to Cynopsis Media's 'Top Women in Sports' list would go here: News | Nets | YES Network

2. Link styling & hover behavior match "Full Link" styling in the Links section of the styleguide: YES Network Button Dropdowns Links Lists
custom_expected:
- When the More $Team$ News link is clicked/tapped, takes the user to the news archive of the team associated to that article. For example: This article's More Nets News link: YES' Sarah Kustok named to Cynopsis Media's 'Top Women in Sports' list would go here: News | Nets | YES Network

- Link styling & hover behavior match "Full Link" styling in the Links section of the styleguide: YES Network Button Dropdowns Links Lists

title: Next News - Create a dynamic content header
custom_preconds:
As a fan, I want to know which News index I am viewing.

User must access URL: http://yes-next-beta.webeng-gcp.mlbinfra.com/yankees/news
custom_steps:
AC

1. Content header dynamically displays $Team Name$ News

EX: YES Network News, Nets News

2. Populated based on slug of articles being pulled onto page
custom_expected:
- Content header dynamically displays $Team Name$ News

EX: YES Network News, Nets News

- Populated based on slug of articles being pulled onto page
